subject: Wages and Salaries
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Louisiana State Coach Les Miles signed a renegotiated five-year contract agreement that, if approved, will make him the highest-paid football coach in the Southeastern Conference. The state university system’s governing board must approve the deal at its April meeting.Miles will earn at least $3.75 million in addition to $1,000 a year and possible incentives, nudging him ahead of Alabama Coach Nick Saban and make him one of the nation’s top-paid college football coaches.The new contract stipulates that Miles be paid no less than the highest-paid coach at a public university in the SEC, plus $1,000. Saban, who is guaranteed $3.75 million, was its highest-paid coach.
